alaPimStdMIB.description: This module describes an authoritative enterprise-specific Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) Management Information Base (MIB): This proprietary MIB contains management information for the configuration of PIM routers. This MIB is based on the Internet Draft <draft-ietf-pim-mib-v2-10.txt> developed by the IETF PIM Working Group. The right to make changes in specification and other information contained in this document without prior notice is reserved. No liability shall be assumed for any incidental, indirect, special, or consequential damages whatsoever arising from or related to this document or the information contained herein. Vendors, end-users, and other interested parties are granted non-exclusive license to use this specification in connection with management of the products for which it is intended to be used. AlaPimMode.name: AlaPimMode
AlaPimMode.description: The PIM mode in which a group is operating. none(1) The group is not using PIM, which may be the case if, for example, it is a link-local or unroutable group address. ssm(2) Source-Specific Multicast (SSM) with PIM Sparse Mode. asm(3) Any Source Multicast (ASM), with PIM Sparse Mode. bidir(4) Bi-directional PIM. dm(5) PIM Dense Mode. other(6) Any other PIM mode.

AlaPimGroupMappingOriginType.name: AlaPimGroupMappingOriginType
AlaPimGroupMappingOriginType.description: The mechanism by which a PIM group mapping was learned. fixed(1) Link-local or unroutable group mappings. configRp(2) Local static RP configuration. configSsm(3) Local SSM Group configuration. bsr(4) The PIM Bootstrap Router (BSR) mechanism. autoRP(5) Cisco's Auto-RP mechanism. embedded(6) The Embedded-RP mechanism where the RP address is embedded in the multicast group address. other(7) Any other mechanism.

alaPimKeepalivePeriod.name: alaPimKeepalivePeriod
alaPimKeepalivePeriod.description: The duration of the Keepalive Timer. This is the period during which the PIM router will maintain (S,G) state in the absence of explicit (S,G) local membership or (S,G) join messages received to maintain it. This timer period is called the Keepalive_Period in the PIM-SM specification. It is called the SourceLifetime in the PIM-DM specification. The storage type of this object is determined by alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType.

alaPimRegisterSuppressionTime.name: alaPimRegisterSuppressionTime
alaPimRegisterSuppressionTime.description: The duration of the Register Suppression Timer. This is the period during which a PIM Designated Router (DR) stops sending Register-encapsulated data to the Rendezvous Point (RP) after receiving a Register-Stop message. This object is used to run timers both at the DR and at the RP. This timer period is called the Register_Suppression_Time in the PIM-SM specification. The storage type of this object is determined by alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType.

alaPimStarGEntries.name: alaPimStarGEntries
alaPimStarGEntries.description: The number of entries in the alaPimStarGTable.

alaPimStarGIEntries.name: alaPimStarGIEntries
alaPimStarGIEntries.description: The number of entries in the alaPimStarGITable.

alaPimSGEntries.name: alaPimSGEntries
alaPimSGEntries.description: The number of entries in the alaPimSGTable.

alaPimSGIEntries.name: alaPimSGIEntries
alaPimSGIEntries.description: The number of entries in the alaPimSGITable.

alaPimSGRptEntries.name: alaPimSGRptEntries
alaPimSGRptEntries.description: The number of entries in the alaPimSGRptTable.

alaPimSGRptIEntries.name: alaPimSGRptIEntries
alaPimSGRptIEntries.description: The number of entries in the alaPimSGRptITable.

alaPimOutAsserts.name: alaPimOutAsserts
alaPimOutAsserts.description: The number of Asserts sent by this router. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, for example when the device is rebooted.

alaPimInAsserts.name: alaPimInAsserts
alaPimInAsserts.description: The number of Asserts received by this router. Asserts are multicast to all routers on a network. This counter is incremented by all routers that receive an assert, not only those routers that are contesting the assert. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, for example when the device is rebooted.

alaPimLastAssertInterface.name: alaPimLastAssertInterface
alaPimLastAssertInterface.description: The interface on which this router most recently sent or received an assert, or zero if this router has not sent or received an assert.

alaPimLastAssertGroupAddressType.name: alaPimLastAssertGroupAddressType
alaPimLastAssertGroupAddressType.description: The address type of the multicast group address in the most recently sent or received assert. If this router has not sent or received an assert then this object is set to unknown(0).

alaPimLastAssertGroupAddress.name: alaPimLastAssertGroupAddress
alaPimLastAssertGroupAddress.description: The multicast group address in the most recently sent or received assert. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimLastAssertGroupAddressType object.

alaPimLastAssertSourceAddressType.name: alaPimLastAssertSourceAddressType
alaPimLastAssertSourceAddressType.description: The address type of the multicast source address in the most recently sent or received assert. If the most recent assert was (*,G), or if this router has not sent or received an assert, then this object is set to unknown(0).

alaPimLastAssertSourceAddress.name: alaPimLastAssertSourceAddress
alaPimLastAssertSourceAddress.description: The multicast source address in the most recently sent or received assert. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimLastAssertSourceAddressType object.

alaPimNeighborLossNotificationPeriod.name: alaPimNeighborLossNotificationPeriod
alaPimNeighborLossNotificationPeriod.description: The minimum time that must elapse between alaPimNeighborLoss notifications originated by this router. The maximum value 65535 represents an 'infinite' time, in which case no alaPimNeighborLoss traps are ever sent. The storage type of this object is determined by alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType.

alaPimNeighborLossCount.name: alaPimNeighborLossCount
alaPimNeighborLossCount.description: The number of neighbor loss events that have occurred. This count is incremented when the neighbor timer expires, and the router has no other neighbors on the same interface with the same IP version and a lower IP address than itself. This counter is incremented whenever a alaPimNeighborLoss notification would be generated. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, for example when the device is rebooted.

alaPimInvalidRegisterNotificationPeriod.name: alaPimInvalidRegisterNotificationPeriod
alaPimInvalidRegisterNotificationPeriod.description: The minimum time that must elapse between alaPimInvalidRegister notifications originated by this router. The default value of 65535 represents an 'infinite' time, in which case no alaPimInvalidRegister notifications are ever sent. The non-zero minimum allowed value provides resilience against propagation of denial-of-service attacks from the data and control planes to the network management plane. The storage type of this object is determined by alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType.

alaPimInvalidRegisterMsgsRcvd.name: alaPimInvalidRegisterMsgsRcvd
alaPimInvalidRegisterMsgsRcvd.reference: RFC 4601 section 4.4.2, RFC 3569 and I-D.ietf-mboned-ip-mcast-mib ipMcastSsmRangeTable
alaPimInvalidRegisterMsgsRcvd.description: The number of invalid PIM Register messages that have been received by this device. A PIM Register message is invalid if either o the destination address of the Register message does not match the Group to RP mapping on this device, or o this device believes the group address to be within an SSM address range, but this Register implies ASM usage. These conditions can occur transiently while RP mapping changes propagate through the network. If this counter is incremented repeatedly over several minutes, then there is a persisting configuration error that requires correction. The active Group to RP mapping on this device is specified by the object alaPimGroupMappingPimMode. If there is no such mapping, then the object alaPimGroupMappingPimMode is absent. The RP address contained in the invalid Register is alaPimInvalidRegisterRp. Multicast data carried by invalid Register messages is discarded. The discarded data is from a source directly connected to alaPimInvalidRegisterOrigin, and is addressed to alaPimInvalidRegisterGroup. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, for example when the device is rebooted.

alaPimInvalidRegisterAddressType.name: alaPimInvalidRegisterAddressType
alaPimInvalidRegisterAddressType.description: The address type stored in alaPimInvalidRegisterOrigin, alaPimInvalidRegisterGroup and alaPimInvalidRegisterRp. If no unexpected Register messages have been received, then this object is set to unknown(0).

alaPimInvalidRegisterOrigin.name: alaPimInvalidRegisterOrigin
alaPimInvalidRegisterOrigin.description: The source address of the last unexpected Register message received by this device.

alaPimInvalidRegisterGroup.name: alaPimInvalidRegisterGroup
alaPimInvalidRegisterGroup.description: The IP multicast group address to which the last unexpected Register message received by this device was addressed.

alaPimInvalidRegisterRp.name: alaPimInvalidRegisterRp
alaPimInvalidRegisterRp.description: The RP address to which the last unexpected Register message received by this device was delivered.

alaPimInvalidJoinPruneNotificationPeriod.name: alaPimInvalidJoinPruneNotificationPeriod
alaPimInvalidJoinPruneNotificationPeriod.description: The minimum time that must elapse between alaPimInvalidJoinPrune notifications originated by this router. The default value of 65535 represents an 'infinite' time, in which case no alaPimInvalidJoinPrune notifications are ever sent. The non-zero minimum allowed value provides resilience against propagation of denial-of-service attacks from the control plane to the network management plane. The storage type of this object is determined by alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType.

alaPimInvalidJoinPruneMsgsRcvd.name: alaPimInvalidJoinPruneMsgsRcvd
alaPimInvalidJoinPruneMsgsRcvd.reference: RFC 4601 section 4.5.2, RFC 3569 and I-D.ietf.mboned-ip-mcast-mib ipMcastSsmRangeTable
alaPimInvalidJoinPruneMsgsRcvd.description: The number of invalid PIM Join/Prune messages that have been received by this device. A PIM Join/Prune message is invalid if either o the Group to RP mapping specified by this message does not match the Group to RP mapping on this device, or o this device believes the group address to be within an SSM address range, but this Join/Prune (*,G) or (S,G,rpt) implies ASM usage. These conditions can occur transiently while RP mapping changes propagate through the network. If this counter is incremented repeatedly over several minutes, then there is a persisting configuration error that requires correction. The active Group to RP mapping on this device is specified by the object alaPimGroupMappingPimMode. If there is no such mapping, then the object alaPimGroupMappingPimMode is absent. The RP address contained in the invalid Join/Prune is alaPimInvalidJoinPruneRp. Invalid Join/Prune messages are discarded. This may result in loss of multicast data affecting listeners downstream of alaPimInvalidJoinPruneOrigin, for multicast data addressed to alaPimInvalidJoinPruneGroup. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, for example when the device is rebooted.

alaPimInvalidJoinPruneAddressType.name: alaPimInvalidJoinPruneAddressType
alaPimInvalidJoinPruneAddressType.description: The address type stored in alaPimInvalidJoinPruneOrigin, alaPimInvalidJoinPruneGroup and alaPimInvalidJoinPruneRp. If no unexpected Join/Prune messages have been received, this object is set to unknown(0).

alaPimInvalidJoinPruneOrigin.name: alaPimInvalidJoinPruneOrigin
alaPimInvalidJoinPruneOrigin.description: The source address of the last unexpected Join/Prune message received by this device.

alaPimInvalidJoinPruneGroup.name: alaPimInvalidJoinPruneGroup
alaPimInvalidJoinPruneGroup.description: The IP multicast group address carried in the last unexpected Join/Prune message received by this device.

alaPimInvalidJoinPruneRp.name: alaPimInvalidJoinPruneRp
alaPimInvalidJoinPruneRp.description: The RP address carried in the last unexpected Join/Prune message received by this device.

alaPimRPMappingNotificationPeriod.name: alaPimRPMappingNotificationPeriod
alaPimRPMappingNotificationPeriod.description: The minimum time that must elapse between alaPimRPMappingChange notifications originated by this router. The default value of 65535 represents an 'infinite' time, in which case no alaPimRPMappingChange notifications are ever sent. The storage type of this object is determined by alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType.

alaPimRPMappingChangeCount.name: alaPimRPMappingChangeCount
alaPimRPMappingChangeCount.description: The number of changes to active RP mappings on this device. Information about active RP mappings is available in alaPimGroupMappingTable. Only changes to active mappings cause this count to be incremented. That is, changes that modify the alaPimGroupMappingEntry with the highest precedence for a group (lowest value of alaPimGroupMappingPrecedence). Such changes may result from manual configuration of this device, or from automatic RP mapping discovery methods including the PIM Bootstrap Router (BSR) mechanism. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, for example when the device is rebooted.

alaPimInterfaceElectionNotificationPerio.name: alaPimInterfaceElectionNotificationPeriod
alaPimInterfaceElectionNotificationPerio.description: The minimum time that must elapse between alaPimInterfaceElection notifications originated by this router. The default value of 65535 represents an 'infinite' time, in which case no alaPimInterfaceElection notifications are ever sent. The storage type of this object is determined by alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType.

alaPimInterfaceElectionWinCount.name: alaPimInterfaceElectionWinCount
alaPimInterfaceElectionWinCount.description: The number of times this device has been elected DR or DF on any interface. Elections occur frequently on newly-active interfaces, as triggered Hellos establish adjacencies. This counter is not incremented for elections on an interface until the first periodic Hello has been sent. If this router is the DR or DF at the time of sending the first periodic Hello after interface activation, then this counter is incremented (once) at that time. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, for example when the device is rebooted.

alaPimRefreshInterval.name: alaPimRefreshInterval
alaPimRefreshInterval.description: The interval between successive State Refresh messages sent by an Originator. This timer period is called the RefreshInterval in the PIM-DM specification. This object is used only by PIM-DM. The storage type of this object is determined by alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType.

alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType.name: alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType
alaPimDeviceConfigStorageType.description: The storage type used for the global PIM configuration of this device, comprised of the objects listed below. If this storage type takes the value 'permanent', write-access to the listed objects need not be allowed. The objects described by this storage type are: alaPimKeepalivePeriod, alaPimRegisterSuppressionTime, alaPimNeighborLossNotificationPeriod, alaPimInvalidRegisterNotificaationPeriod, alaPimInvalidJoinPruneNotificationPeriod, alaPimRPMappingNotificationPeriod, alaPimInterfaceElectionNotificationPeriod and alaPimRefreshInterval.

alaPimInterfaceTable.name: alaPimInterfaceTable
alaPimInterfaceTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM interfaces. PIM is enabled on all interfaces listed in this table.

alaPimInterfaceEntry.name: alaPimInterfaceEntry
alaPimInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimInterfaceTable. This entry is preserved on agent restart.

alaPimInterfaceIfIndex.name: alaPimInterfaceIfIndex
alaPimInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of this PIM interface.

alaPimInterfaceIPVersion.name: alaPimInterfaceIPVersion
alaPimInterfaceIPVersion.description: The IP version of this PIM interface. A physical interface may be configured in multiple modes concurrently, e.g. IPv4 and IPv6, however the traffic is considered to be logically separate.

alaPimInterfaceAddressType.name: alaPimInterfaceAddressType
alaPimInterfaceAddressType.description: The address type of this PIM interface.

alaPimInterfaceAddress.name: alaPimInterfaceAddress
alaPimInterfaceAddress.description: The primary IP address of this router on this PIM interface. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimInterfaceAddressType object.

alaPimInterfaceGenerationIDValue.name: alaPimInterfaceGenerationIDValue
alaPimInterfaceGenerationIDValue.description: The value of the Generation ID this router inserted in the last PIM Hello message it sent on this interface.

alaPimInterfaceDR.name: alaPimInterfaceDR
alaPimInterfaceDR.description: The primary IP address of the Designated Router on this PIM interface. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimInterfaceAddressType object.

alaPimInterfaceDRPriority.name: alaPimInterfaceDRPriority
alaPimInterfaceDRPriority.description: The Designated Router Priority value inserted into the DR Priority option on this interface. Numerically higher values for this object indicate higher priorities.

alaPimInterfaceDRPriorityEnabled.name: alaPimInterfaceDRPriorityEnabled
alaPimInterfaceDRPriorityEnabled.description: Evaluates to TRUE if all routers on this interface are using the DR Priority option.

alaPimInterfaceHelloInterval.name: alaPimInterfaceHelloInterval
alaPimInterfaceHelloInterval.description: The frequency at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted on this interface. This object corresponds to the 'Hello_Period' timer value defined in the PIM-SM specification. A value of zero represents an 'infinite' interval, and indicates that periodic PIM Hello messages should not be sent on this interface.

alaPimInterfaceTrigHelloInterval.name: alaPimInterfaceTrigHelloInterval
alaPimInterfaceTrigHelloInterval.description: The maximum time before this router sends a triggered PIM Hello message on this interface. This object corresponds to the 'Trigered_Hello_Delay' timer value defined in the PIM-SM specification. A value of zero has no special meaning and indicates that triggered PIM Hello messages should always be sent immediately.

alaPimInterfaceHelloHoldtime.name: alaPimInterfaceHelloHoldtime
alaPimInterfaceHelloHoldtime.description: The value set in the Holdtime field of PIM Hello messages transmitted on this interface. A value of 65535 represents an 'infinite' holdtime. Implementations are recommended to use a holdtime that is 3.5 times the value of alaPimInterfaceHelloInterval, or 65535 if alaPimInterfaceHelloInterval is set to zero.

alaPimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.name: alaPimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval
alaPimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.description: The frequency at which this router sends PIM Join/Prune messages on this PIM interface. This object corresponds to the 't_periodic' timer value defined in the PIM-SM specification. A value of zero represents an 'infinite' interval, and indicates that periodic PIM Join/Prune messages should not be sent on this interface.

alaPimInterfaceJoinPruneHoldtime.name: alaPimInterfaceJoinPruneHoldtime
alaPimInterfaceJoinPruneHoldtime.description: The value inserted into the Holdtime field of a PIM Join/Prune message sent on this interface. A value of 65535 represents an 'infinite' holdtime. Implementations are recommended to use a holdtime that is 3.5 times the value of alaPimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval, or 65535 if alaPimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval is set to zero. PIM-DM implementations are recommended to use the value of alaPimInterfacePruneLimitInterval.

alaPimInterfaceDFElectionRobustness.name: alaPimInterfaceDFElectionRobustness
alaPimInterfaceDFElectionRobustness.description: The minimum number of PIM DF-Election messages that must be lost in order for DF election on this interface to fail.

alaPimInterfaceLanDelayEnabled.name: alaPimInterfaceLanDelayEnabled
alaPimInterfaceLanDelayEnabled.description: Evaluates to TRUE if all routers on this interface are using the LAN Prune Delay option.

alaPimInterfacePropagationDelay.name: alaPimInterfacePropagationDelay
alaPimInterfacePropagationDelay.description: The expected propagation delay between PIM routers on this network or link. This router inserts this value into the Propagation_Delay field of the LAN Prune Delay option in the PIM Hello messages sent on this interface. Implementations should enforce a lower bound on the permitted values for this object to allow for scheduling and processing delays within the local router.

alaPimInterfaceOverrideInterval.name: alaPimInterfaceOverrideInterval
alaPimInterfaceOverrideInterval.description: The value this router inserts into the Override_Interval field of the LAN Prune Delay option in the PIM Hello messages it sends on this interface. When overriding a prune, PIM routers pick a random timer duration up to the value of this object. The more PIM routers that are active on a network, the more likely it is that the prune will be overridden after a small proportion of this time has elapsed. The more PIM routers are active on this network, the larger this object should be to obtain an optimal spread of prune override latencies.

alaPimInterfaceEffectPropagDelay.name: alaPimInterfaceEffectPropagDelay
alaPimInterfaceEffectPropagDelay.description: The Effective Propagation Delay on this interface. This object is always 500 if alaPimInterfaceLanDelayEnabled is FALSE.

alaPimInterfaceEffectOverrideIvl.name: alaPimInterfaceEffectOverrideIvl
alaPimInterfaceEffectOverrideIvl.description: The Effective Override Interval on this interface. This object is always 2500 if alaPimInterfaceLanDelayEnabled is FALSE.

alaPimInterfaceSuppressionEnabled.name: alaPimInterfaceSuppressionEnabled
alaPimInterfaceSuppressionEnabled.description: Whether join suppression is enabled on this interface. This object is always TRUE if alaPimInterfaceLanDelayEnabled is FALSE.

alaPimInterfaceBidirCapable.name: alaPimInterfaceBidirCapable
alaPimInterfaceBidirCapable.description: Evaluates to TRUE if all routers on this interface are using the Bidirectional-PIM Capable option.

alaPimInterfaceDomainBorder.name: alaPimInterfaceDomainBorder
alaPimInterfaceDomainBorder.description: Whether or not this interface is a PIM domain border. This includes acting as a border for PIM Bootstrap Router (BSR) messages, if the BSR mechanism is in use.

alaPimInterfaceStubInterface.name: alaPimInterfaceStubInterface
alaPimInterfaceStubInterface.description: Whether this interface is a 'stub interface'. If this object is set to TRUE, then no PIM packets are sent out this interface, and any received PIM packets are ignored. Setting this object to TRUE is a security measure for interfaces towards untrusted hosts. This allows an interface to be configured for use with IGMP (Internet Group Management Protocol) or MLD (Multicast Listener Discovery) only, which protects the PIM router from forged PIM messages on the interface. To communicate with other PIM routers using this interface, this object must remain set to FALSE. Changing the value of this object while the interface is operational causes the interface to be deactivated and then reactivated.

alaPimInterfacePruneLimitInterval.name: alaPimInterfacePruneLimitInterval
alaPimInterfacePruneLimitInterval.description: The minimum interval that must transpire between two successive Prunes sent by a router. This object corresponds to the 't_limit' timer value defined in the PIM-DM specification. This object is used only by PIM-DM.

alaPimInterfaceGraftRetryInterval.name: alaPimInterfaceGraftRetryInterval
alaPimInterfaceGraftRetryInterval.description: The minimum interval that must transpire between two successive Grafts sent by a router. This object corresponds to the 'Graft_Retry_Period' timer value defined in the PIM-DM specification. This object is used only by PIM-DM.

alaPimInterfaceSRPriorityEnabled.name: alaPimInterfaceSRPriorityEnabled
alaPimInterfaceSRPriorityEnabled.description: Evaluates to TRUE if all routers on this interface are using the State Refresh option. This object is used only by PIM-DM.

alaPimInterfaceStatus.name: alaPimInterfaceStatus
alaPimInterfaceStatus.description: The status of this entry. Creating the entry enables PIM on the interface; destroying the entry disables PIM on the interface. This status object can be set to active(1) without setting any other columnar objects in this entry. All writeable objects in this entry can be modified when the status of this entry is active(1).

alaPimInterfaceStorageType.name: alaPimInterfaceStorageType
alaPimInterfaceStorageType.description: The storage type for this row. Rows having the value 'permanent' need not allow write-access to any columnar objects in the row.

alaPimNeighborTable.name: alaPimNeighborTable
alaPimNeighborTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM neighbors.

alaPimNeighborEntry.name: alaPimNeighborEntry
alaPimNeighborEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimNeighborTable.

alaPimNeighborIfIndex.name: alaPimNeighborIfIndex
alaPimNeighborIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this PIM neighbor.

alaPimNeighborAddressType.name: alaPimNeighborAddressType
alaPimNeighborAddressType.description: The address type of this PIM neighbor.

alaPimNeighborAddress.name: alaPimNeighborAddress
alaPimNeighborAddress.description: The primary IP address of this PIM neighbor. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimNeighborAddressType object.

alaPimNeighborGenerationIDPresent.name: alaPimNeighborGenerationIDPresent
alaPimNeighborGenerationIDPresent.description: Evaluates to TRUE if this neighbor is using the Generation ID option.

alaPimNeighborGenerationIDValue.name: alaPimNeighborGenerationIDValue
alaPimNeighborGenerationIDValue.description: The value of the Generation ID from the last PIM Hello message received from this neighbor. This object is always zero if alaPimNeighborGenerationIDPresent is FALSE.

alaPimNeighborUpTime.name: alaPimNeighborUpTime
alaPimNeighborUpTime.description: The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor of the local router.

alaPimNeighborExpiryTime.name: alaPimNeighborExpiryTime
alaPimNeighborExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before this PIM neighbor will be aged out. The value zero indicates that this PIM neighbor will never be aged out.

alaPimNeighborDRPriorityPresent.name: alaPimNeighborDRPriorityPresent
alaPimNeighborDRPriorityPresent.description: Evaluates to TRUE if this neighbor is using the DR Priority option.

alaPimNeighborDRPriority.name: alaPimNeighborDRPriority
alaPimNeighborDRPriority.description: The value of the Designated Router Priority from the last PIM Hello message received from this neighbor. This object is always zero if alaPimNeighborDRPriorityPresent is FALSE.

alaPimNeighborLanPruneDelayPresent.name: alaPimNeighborLanPruneDelayPresent
alaPimNeighborLanPruneDelayPresent.description: Evaluates to TRUE if this neighbor is using the LAN Prune Delay option.

alaPimNeighborTBit.name: alaPimNeighborTBit
alaPimNeighborTBit.description: Whether the T bit was set in the LAN Prune Delay option received from this neighbor. The T bit specifies the ability of the neighbor to disable join suppression. This object is always TRUE if alaPimNeighborLanPruneDelayPresent is FALSE.

alaPimNeighborPropagationDelay.name: alaPimNeighborPropagationDelay
alaPimNeighborPropagationDelay.description: The value of the Propagation_Delay field of the LAN Prune Delay option received from this neighbor. This object is always zero if alaPimNeighborLanPruneDelayPresent is FALSE.

alaPimNeighborOverrideInterval.name: alaPimNeighborOverrideInterval
alaPimNeighborOverrideInterval.description: The value of the Override_Interval field of the LAN Prune Delay option received from this neighbor. This object is always zero if alaPimNeighborLanPruneDelayPresent is FALSE.

alaPimNeighborBidirCapable.name: alaPimNeighborBidirCapable
alaPimNeighborBidirCapable.description: Evaluates to TRUE if this neighbor is using the Bidirectional-PIM Capable option.

alaPimNeighborSRCapable.name: alaPimNeighborSRCapable
alaPimNeighborSRCapable.description: Evaluates to TRUE if this neighbor is using the State Refresh Capable option. This object is used only by PIM-DM.

alaPimNbrSecAddressTable.name: alaPimNbrSecAddressTable
alaPimNbrSecAddressTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the secondary addresses advertised by each PIM neighbor (on a subset of the rows of the alaPimNeighborTable defined above).

alaPimNbrSecAddressEntry.name: alaPimNbrSecAddressEntry
alaPimNbrSecAddressEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimNbrSecAddressTable.

alaPimNbrSecAddressIfIndex.name: alaPimNbrSecAddressIfIndex
alaPimNbrSecAddressIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the interface used to reach this PIM neighbor.

alaPimNbrSecAddressType.name: alaPimNbrSecAddressType
alaPimNbrSecAddressType.description: The address type of this PIM neighbor.

alaPimNbrSecAddressPrimary.name: alaPimNbrSecAddressPrimary
alaPimNbrSecAddressPrimary.description: The primary IP address of this PIM neighbor. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimNbrSecAddressType object.

alaPimNbrSecAddress.name: alaPimNbrSecAddress
alaPimNbrSecAddress.description: The secondary IP address of this PIM neighbor. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimNbrSecAddressType object.

alaPimStarGTable.name: alaPimStarGTable
alaPimStarGTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the non-interface specific (*,G) state that PIM has.

alaPimStarGEntry.name: alaPimStarGEntry
alaPimStarGEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimStarGTable.

alaPimStarGAddressType.name: alaPimStarGAddressType
alaPimStarGAddressType.description: The address type of this multicast group.

alaPimStarGGrpAddress.name: alaPimStarGGrpAddress
alaPimStarGGrpAddress.description: The multicast group address. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStarGAddressType object.

alaPimStarGUpTime.name: alaPimStarGUpTime
alaPimStarGUpTime.description: The time since this entry was created by the local router.

alaPimStarGPimMode.name: alaPimStarGPimMode
alaPimStarGPimMode.description: Whether this entry represents an ASM (Any Source Multicast, used with PIM-SM) or BIDIR-PIM group.

alaPimStarGRPAddressType.name: alaPimStarGRPAddressType
alaPimStarGRPAddressType.description: The address type of the Rendezvous Point (RP), or unknown(0) if the RP address is unknown.

alaPimStarGRPAddress.name: alaPimStarGRPAddress
alaPimStarGRPAddress.description: The address of the Rendezvous Point (RP) for the group. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStarGRPAddressType.

alaPimStarGPimModeOrigin.name: alaPimStarGPimModeOrigin
alaPimStarGPimModeOrigin.description: The mechanism by which the PIM mode and RP for the group were learned.

alaPimStarGRPIsLocal.name: alaPimStarGRPIsLocal
alaPimStarGRPIsLocal.description: Whether the local router is the RP for the group.

alaPimStarGUpstreamJoinState.name: alaPimStarGUpstreamJoinState
alaPimStarGUpstreamJoinState.description: Whether the local router should join the RP tree for the group. This corresponds to the state of the upstream (*,G) state machine in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimStarGUpstreamJoinTimer.name: alaPimStarGUpstreamJoinTimer
alaPimStarGUpstreamJoinTimer.description: The time remaining before the local router next sends a periodic (*,G) Join message on alaPimStarGRPFIfIndex. This timer is called the (*,G) Upstream Join Timer in the PIM-SM specification. This object is zero if the timer is not running.

alaPimStarGUpstreamNeighborType.name: alaPimStarGUpstreamNeighborType
alaPimStarGUpstreamNeighborType.description: The primary address type of the upstream neighbor, or unknown(0) if the upstream neighbor address is unknown or is not a PIM neighbor.

alaPimStarGUpstreamNeighbor.name: alaPimStarGUpstreamNeighbor
alaPimStarGUpstreamNeighbor.description: The primary address of the neighbor on alaPimStarGRPFIfIndex that the local router is sending periodic (*,G) Join messages to. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStarGUpstreamNeighborType object. This address is called RPF'(*,G) in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimStarGRPFIfIndex.name: alaPimStarGRPFIfIndex
alaPimStarGRPFIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the RPF interface towards the RP, or zero if the RPF interface is unknown.

alaPimStarGRPFNextHopType.name: alaPimStarGRPFNextHopType
alaPimStarGRPFNextHopType.description: The address type of the RPF next hop towards the RP, or unknown(0) if the RPF next hop is unknown.

alaPimStarGRPFNextHop.name: alaPimStarGRPFNextHop
alaPimStarGRPFNextHop.description: The address of the RPF next hop towards the RP. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStarGRPFNextHopType object. This address is called MRIB.next_hop(RP(G)) in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimStarGRPFRouteProtocol.name: alaPimStarGRPFRouteProtocol
alaPimStarGRPFRouteProtocol.description: The routing mechanism via which the route used to find the RPF interface towards the RP was learned.

alaPimStarGRPFRouteAddress.name: alaPimStarGRPFRouteAddress
alaPimStarGRPFRouteAddress.description: The IP address which when combined with the corresponding value of alaPimStarGRPFRoutePrefixLength identifies the route used to find the RPF interface towards the RP. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStarGRPFNextHopType object. This address object is only significant up to alaPimStarGRPFRoutePrefixLength bits. The remainder of the address bits are zero.

alaPimStarGRPFRoutePrefixLength.name: alaPimStarGRPFRoutePrefixLength
alaPimStarGRPFRoutePrefixLength.description: The prefix length which when combined with the corresponding value of alaPimStarGRPFRouteAddress identifies the route used to find the RPF interface towards the RP. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStarGRPFNextHopType object.

alaPimStarGRPFRouteMetricPref.name: alaPimStarGRPFRouteMetricPref
alaPimStarGRPFRouteMetricPref.description: The metric preference of the route used to find the RPF interface towards the RP.

alaPimStarGRPFRouteMetric.name: alaPimStarGRPFRouteMetric
alaPimStarGRPFRouteMetric.description: The routing metric of the route used to find the RPF interface towards the RP.

alaPimStarGITable.name: alaPimStarGITable
alaPimStarGITable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the interface-specific (*,G) state that PIM has.

alaPimStarGIEntry.name: alaPimStarGIEntry
alaPimStarGIEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimStarGITable.

alaPimStarGIIfIndex.name: alaPimStarGIIfIndex
alaPimStarGIIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the interface that this entry corresponds to.

alaPimStarGIUpTime.name: alaPimStarGIUpTime
alaPimStarGIUpTime.description: The time since this entry was created by the local router.

alaPimStarGILocalMembership.name: alaPimStarGILocalMembership
alaPimStarGILocalMembership.description: Whether the local router has (*,G) local membership on this interface (resulting from a mechanism such as IGMP or MLD). This corresponds to local_receiver_include(*,G,I) in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimStarGIJoinPruneState.name: alaPimStarGIJoinPruneState
alaPimStarGIJoinPruneState.description: The state resulting from (*,G) Join/Prune messages received on this interface. This corresponds to the state of the downstream per-interface (*,G) state machine in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimStarGIPrunePendingTimer.name: alaPimStarGIPrunePendingTimer
alaPimStarGIPrunePendingTimer.description: The time remaining before the local router acts on a (*,G) Prune message received on this interface, during which the router is waiting to see whether another downstream router will override the Prune message. This timer is called the (*,G) Prune-Pending Timer in the PIM-SM specification. This object is zero if the timer is not running.

alaPimStarGIJoinExpiryTimer.name: alaPimStarGIJoinExpiryTimer
alaPimStarGIJoinExpiryTimer.description: The time remaining before (*,G) Join state for this interface expires. This timer is called the (*,G) Join Expiry Timer in the PIM-SM specification. This object is zero if the timer is not running. A value of 'FFFFFFFF'h indicates an infinite expiry time.

alaPimStarGIAssertState.name: alaPimStarGIAssertState
alaPimStarGIAssertState.description: The (*,G) Assert state for this interface. This corresponds to the state of the per-interface (*,G) Assert state machine in the PIM-SM specification. If alaPimStarGPimMode is 'bidir', this object must be 'noInfo'.

alaPimStarGIAssertTimer.name: alaPimStarGIAssertTimer
alaPimStarGIAssertTimer.description: If alaPimStarGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertWinner', this is the time remaining before the local router next sends a (*,G) Assert message on this interface. If alaPimStarGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertLoser', this is the time remaining before the (*,G) Assert state expires. If alaPimStarGIAssertState is 'noInfo', this is zero. This timer is called the (*,G) Assert Timer in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerAddressType.name: alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerAddressType
alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerAddressType.description: If alaPimStarGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertLoser', this is the address type of the assert winner; otherwise, this object is unknown(0).

alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerAddress.name: alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerAddress
alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerAddress.description: If alaPimStarGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertLoser', this is the address of the assert winner. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerAddressType object.

alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerMetricPref.name: alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerMetricPref
alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerMetricPref.description: If alaPimStarGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertLoser', this is the metric preference of the route to the RP advertised by the assert winner; otherwise, this object is zero.

alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerMetric.name: alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerMetric
alaPimStarGIAssertWinnerMetric.description: If alaPimStarGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertLoser', this is the routing metric of the route to the RP advertised by the assert winner; otherwise, this object is zero.

alaPimSGTable.name: alaPimSGTable
alaPimSGTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the non-interface specific (S,G) state that PIM has.

alaPimSGEntry.name: alaPimSGEntry
alaPimSGEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimSGTable.

alaPimSGAddressType.name: alaPimSGAddressType
alaPimSGAddressType.description: The address type of the source and multicast group for this entry.

alaPimSGGrpAddress.name: alaPimSGGrpAddress
alaPimSGGrpAddress.description: The multicast group address for this entry. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimSGAddressType object.

alaPimSGSrcAddress.name: alaPimSGSrcAddress
alaPimSGSrcAddress.description: The source address for this entry. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimSGAddressType object.

alaPimSGUpTime.name: alaPimSGUpTime
alaPimSGUpTime.description: The time since this entry was created by the local router.

alaPimSGPimMode.name: alaPimSGPimMode
alaPimSGPimMode.reference: RFC 4601 sections 4.5.2, RFC 3569 and I-D.ietf-mboned-ip-mcast-mib ipMcastSsmRangeTable
alaPimSGPimMode.description: Whether alaPimSGGrpAddress is an SSM (Source Specific Multicast, used with PIM-SM) or ASM (Any Source Multicast, used with PIM-SM), or DM (Dense Mode) group.

alaPimSGUpstreamJoinState.name: alaPimSGUpstreamJoinState
alaPimSGUpstreamJoinState.description: Whether the local router should join the shortest-path tree for the source and group represented by this entry. This corresponds to the state of the upstream (S,G) state machine in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGUpstreamJoinTimer.name: alaPimSGUpstreamJoinTimer
alaPimSGUpstreamJoinTimer.description: The time remaining before the local router next sends a periodic (S,G) Join message on alaPimSGRPFIfIndex. This timer is called the (S,G) Upstream Join Timer in the PIM-SM specification. This object is zero if the timer is not running.

alaPimSGUpstreamNeighbor.name: alaPimSGUpstreamNeighbor
alaPimSGUpstreamNeighbor.description: The primary address of the neighbor on alaPimSGRPFIfIndex that the local router is sending periodic (S,G) Join messages to. This is zero if the RPF next hop is unknown or is not a PIM neighbor. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimSGAddressType object. This address is called RPF'(S,G) in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGRPFIfIndex.name: alaPimSGRPFIfIndex
alaPimSGRPFIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the RPF interface towards the source, or zero if the RPF interface is unknown.

alaPimSGRPFNextHopType.name: alaPimSGRPFNextHopType
alaPimSGRPFNextHopType.description: The address type of the RPF next hop towards the source, or unknown(0) if the RPF next hop is unknown.

alaPimSGRPFNextHop.name: alaPimSGRPFNextHop
alaPimSGRPFNextHop.description: The address of the RPF next hop towards the source. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimSGRPFNextHopType. This address is called MRIB.next_hop(S) in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGRPFRouteProtocol.name: alaPimSGRPFRouteProtocol
alaPimSGRPFRouteProtocol.description: The routing mechanism via which the route used to find the RPF interface towards the source was learned.

alaPimSGRPFRouteAddress.name: alaPimSGRPFRouteAddress
alaPimSGRPFRouteAddress.description: The IP address which when combined with the corresponding value of alaPimSGRPFRoutePrefixLength identifies the route used to find the RPF interface towards the source. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimSGRPFNextHopType object. This address object is only significant up to alaPimSGRPFRoutePrefixLength bits. The remainder of the address bits are zero.

alaPimSGRPFRoutePrefixLength.name: alaPimSGRPFRoutePrefixLength
alaPimSGRPFRoutePrefixLength.description: The prefix length which when combined with the corresponding value of alaPimSGRPFRouteAddress identifies the route used to find the RPF interface towards the source. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimSGRPFNextHopType object.

alaPimSGRPFRouteMetricPref.name: alaPimSGRPFRouteMetricPref
alaPimSGRPFRouteMetricPref.description: The metric preference of the route used to find the RPF interface towards the source.

alaPimSGRPFRouteMetric.name: alaPimSGRPFRouteMetric
alaPimSGRPFRouteMetric.description: The routing metric of the route used to find the RPF interface towards the source.

alaPimSGSPTBit.name: alaPimSGSPTBit
alaPimSGSPTBit.description: Whether the SPT bit is set; and therefore whether forwarding is taking place on the shortest-path tree.

alaPimSGKeepaliveTimer.name: alaPimSGKeepaliveTimer
alaPimSGKeepaliveTimer.description: The time remaining before, in the absence of explicit (S,G) local membership or (S,G) Join messages received to maintain it, this (S,G) state expires. This timer is called the (S,G) Keepalive Timer in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGDRRegisterState.name: alaPimSGDRRegisterState
alaPimSGDRRegisterState.description: Whether the local router should encapsulate (S,G) data packets in Register messages and send them to the RP. This corresponds to the state of the per-(S,G) Register state machine in the PIM-SM specification. This object is always 'noInfo' unless alaPimSGPimMode is 'asm'.

alaPimSGDRRegisterStopTimer.name: alaPimSGDRRegisterStopTimer
alaPimSGDRRegisterStopTimer.description: If alaPimSGDRRegisterState is 'prune', this is the time remaining before the local router sends a Null-Register message to the RP. If alaPimSGDRRegisterState is 'joinPending', this is the time remaining before the local router resumes encapsulating data packets and sending them to the RP. Otherwise, this is zero. This timer is called the Register-Stop Timer in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGRPRegisterPMBRAddressType.name: alaPimSGRPRegisterPMBRAddressType
alaPimSGRPRegisterPMBRAddressType.description: The address type of the first PIM Multicast Border Router to send a Register message with the Border bit set. This object is unknown(0) if the local router is not the RP for the group.

alaPimSGRPRegisterPMBRAddress.name: alaPimSGRPRegisterPMBRAddress
alaPimSGRPRegisterPMBRAddress.description: The IP address of the first PIM Multicast Border Router to send a Register message with the Border bit set. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimSGRPRegisterPMBRAddressType object.

alaPimSGUpstreamPruneState.name: alaPimSGUpstreamPruneState
alaPimSGUpstreamPruneState.description: Whether the local router has pruned itself from the tree. This corresponds to the state of the upstream prune (S,G) state machine in the PIM-DM specification. This object is used only by PIM-DM.

alaPimSGUpstreamPruneLimitTimer.name: alaPimSGUpstreamPruneLimitTimer
alaPimSGUpstreamPruneLimitTimer.description: The time remaining before the local router may send a (S,G) Prune message on alaPimSGRPFIfIndex. This timer is called the (S,G) Prune Limit Timer in the PIM-DM specification. This object is zero if the timer is not running. This object is used only by PIM-DM.

alaPimSGOriginatorState.name: alaPimSGOriginatorState
alaPimSGOriginatorState.description: Whether the router is an originator for an (S,G) message flow. This corresponds to the state of the per-(S,G) Originator state machine in the PIM-DM specification. This object is used only by PIM-DM.

alaPimSGSourceActiveTimer.name: alaPimSGSourceActiveTimer
alaPimSGSourceActiveTimer.description: If alaPimSGOriginatorState is 'originator', this is the time remaining before the local router reverts to a notOriginator state. Otherwise, this is zero. This timer is called the Source Active Timer in the PIM-DM specification. This object is used only by PIM-DM.

alaPimSGStateRefreshTimer.name: alaPimSGStateRefreshTimer
alaPimSGStateRefreshTimer.description: If alaPimSGOriginatorState is 'originator', this is the time remaining before the local router sends a State Refresh message. Otherwise, this is zero. This timer is called the State Refresh Timer in the PIM-DM specification. This object is used only by PIM-DM.

alaPimSGITable.name: alaPimSGITable
alaPimSGITable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the interface-specific (S,G) state that PIM has.

alaPimSGIEntry.name: alaPimSGIEntry
alaPimSGIEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimSGITable.

alaPimSGIIfIndex.name: alaPimSGIIfIndex
alaPimSGIIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the interface that this entry corresponds to.

alaPimSGIUpTime.name: alaPimSGIUpTime
alaPimSGIUpTime.description: The time since this entry was created by the local router.

alaPimSGILocalMembership.name: alaPimSGILocalMembership
alaPimSGILocalMembership.description: Whether the local router has (S,G) local membership on this interface (resulting from a mechanism such as IGMP or MLD). This corresponds to local_receiver_include(S,G,I) in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGIJoinPruneState.name: alaPimSGIJoinPruneState
alaPimSGIJoinPruneState.description: The state resulting from (S,G) Join/Prune messages received on this interface. This corresponds to the state of the downstream per-interface (S,G) state machine in the PIM-SM and PIM-DM specification.

alaPimSGIPrunePendingTimer.name: alaPimSGIPrunePendingTimer
alaPimSGIPrunePendingTimer.description: The time remaining before the local router acts on an (S,G) Prune message received on this interface, during which the router is waiting to see whether another downstream router will override the Prune message. This timer is called the (S,G) Prune-Pending Timer in the PIM-SM specification. This object is zero if the timer is not running.

alaPimSGIJoinExpiryTimer.name: alaPimSGIJoinExpiryTimer
alaPimSGIJoinExpiryTimer.description: The time remaining before (S,G) Join state for this interface expires. This timer is called the (S,G) Join Expiry Timer in the PIM-SM specification. This object is zero if the timer is not running. A value of 'FFFFFFFF'h indicates an infinite expiry time. This timer is called the (S,G) Prune Timer in the PIM-DM specification.

alaPimSGIAssertState.name: alaPimSGIAssertState
alaPimSGIAssertState.description: The (S,G) Assert state for this interface. This corresponds to the state of the per-interface (S,G) Assert state machine in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGIAssertTimer.name: alaPimSGIAssertTimer
alaPimSGIAssertTimer.description: If alaPimSGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertWinner', this is the time remaining before the local router next sends a (S,G) Assert message on this interface. If alaPimSGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertLoser', this is the time remaining before the (S,G) Assert state expires. If alaPimSGIAssertState is 'noInfo', this is zero. This timer is called the (S,G) Assert Timer in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGIAssertWinnerAddressType.name: alaPimSGIAssertWinnerAddressType
alaPimSGIAssertWinnerAddressType.description: If alaPimSGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertLoser', this is the address type of the assert winner; otherwise, this object is unknown(0).

alaPimSGIAssertWinnerAddress.name: alaPimSGIAssertWinnerAddress
alaPimSGIAssertWinnerAddress.description: If alaPimSGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertLoser', this is the address of the assert winner. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimSGIAssertWinnerAddressType object.

alaPimSGIAssertWinnerMetricPref.name: alaPimSGIAssertWinnerMetricPref
alaPimSGIAssertWinnerMetricPref.description: If alaPimSGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertLoser', this is the metric preference of the route to the source advertised by the assert winner; otherwise, this object is zero.

alaPimSGIAssertWinnerMetric.name: alaPimSGIAssertWinnerMetric
alaPimSGIAssertWinnerMetric.description: If alaPimSGIAssertState is 'iAmAssertLoser', this is the routing metric of the route to the source advertised by the assert winner; otherwise, this object is zero.

alaPimSGRptTable.name: alaPimSGRptTable
alaPimSGRptTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the non-interface specific (S,G,rpt) state that PIM has.

alaPimSGRptEntry.name: alaPimSGRptEntry
alaPimSGRptEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimSGRptTable.

alaPimSGRptSrcAddress.name: alaPimSGRptSrcAddress
alaPimSGRptSrcAddress.description: The source address for this entry. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStarGAddressType object.

alaPimSGRptUpTime.name: alaPimSGRptUpTime
alaPimSGRptUpTime.description: The time since this entry was created by the local router.

alaPimSGRptUpstreamPruneState.name: alaPimSGRptUpstreamPruneState
alaPimSGRptUpstreamPruneState.description: Whether the local router should prune the source off the RP tree. This corresponds to the state of the upstream (S,G,rpt) state machine for triggered messages in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGRptUpstreamOverrideTimer.name: alaPimSGRptUpstreamOverrideTimer
alaPimSGRptUpstreamOverrideTimer.description: The time remaining before the local router sends a triggered (S,G,rpt) Join message on alaPimStarGRPFIfIndex. This timer is called the (S,G,rpt) Upstream Override Timer in the PIM-SM specification. This object is zero if the timer is not running.

alaPimSGRptITable.name: alaPimSGRptITable
alaPimSGRptITable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the interface-specific (S,G,rpt) state that PIM has.

alaPimSGRptIEntry.name: alaPimSGRptIEntry
alaPimSGRptIEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimSGRptITable.

alaPimSGRptIIfIndex.name: alaPimSGRptIIfIndex
alaPimSGRptIIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the interface that this entry corresponds to.

alaPimSGRptIUpTime.name: alaPimSGRptIUpTime
alaPimSGRptIUpTime.description: The time since this entry was created by the local router.

alaPimSGRptILocalMembership.name: alaPimSGRptILocalMembership
alaPimSGRptILocalMembership.description: Whether the local router has both (*,G) include local membership and (S,G) exclude local membership on this interface (resulting from a mechanism such as IGMP or MLD). This corresponds to local_receiver_exclude(S,G,I) in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGRptIJoinPruneState.name: alaPimSGRptIJoinPruneState
alaPimSGRptIJoinPruneState.description: The state resulting from (S,G,rpt) Join/Prune messages received on this interface. This corresponds to the state of the downstream per-interface (S,G,rpt) state machine in the PIM-SM specification.

alaPimSGRptIPrunePendingTimer.name: alaPimSGRptIPrunePendingTimer
alaPimSGRptIPrunePendingTimer.description: The time remaining before the local router starts pruning this source off the RP tree. This timer is called the (S,G,rpt) Prune-Pending Timer in the PIM-SM specification. This object is zero if the timer is not running.

alaPimSGRptIPruneExpiryTimer.name: alaPimSGRptIPruneExpiryTimer
alaPimSGRptIPruneExpiryTimer.description: The time remaining before (S,G,rpt) Prune state for this interface expires. This timer is called the (S,G,rpt) Prune Expiry Timer in the PIM-SM specification. This object is zero if the timer is not running. A value of 'FFFFFFFF'h indicates an infinite expiry time.

alaPimStaticRPTable.name: alaPimStaticRPTable
alaPimStaticRPTable.description: This table is used to create and manage static configuration of RPs. If the group prefixes configured for two or more rows in this table overlap, the row with the greatest value of alaPimStaticRPGrpPrefixLength is used for the overlapping range.

alaPimStaticRPEntry.name: alaPimStaticRPEntry
alaPimStaticRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimStaticRPTable. This entry is preserved on agent restart.

alaPimStaticRPAddressType.name: alaPimStaticRPAddressType
alaPimStaticRPAddressType.description: The address type of this entry.

alaPimStaticRPGrpAddress.name: alaPimStaticRPGrpAddress
alaPimStaticRPGrpAddress.description: The multicast group address which, when combined with alaPimStaticRPGrpPrefixLength, gives the group prefix for this entry. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStaticRPAddressType object. This address object is only significant up to alaPimSGRPFRoutePrefixLength bits. The remainder of the address bits are zero. This is especially important for this index field, which is part of the index of this entry. Any non-zero bits would signify an entirely different entry.

alaPimStaticRPGrpPrefixLength.name: alaPimStaticRPGrpPrefixLength
alaPimStaticRPGrpPrefixLength.description: The multicast group prefix length, which, when combined with alaPimStaticRPGrpAddress, gives the group prefix for this entry. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStaticRPAddressType object. If alaPimStaticRPAddressType is 'ipv4' or 'ipv4z', this object must be in the range 4..32. If alaPimStaticRPGrpAddressType is 'ipv6' or 'ipv6z', this object must be in the range 8..128.

alaPimStaticRPRPAddress.name: alaPimStaticRPRPAddress
alaPimStaticRPRPAddress.description: The IP address of the RP to be used for groups within this group prefix. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimStaticRPAddressType object.

alaPimStaticRPPimMode.name: alaPimStaticRPPimMode
alaPimStaticRPPimMode.reference: RFC 4601 section 3.7, RFC 3569 and I-D.ietf-mboned-ip-mcast-mib ipMcastSsmRangeTable
alaPimStaticRPPimMode.description: The PIM mode to be used for groups in this group prefix. If this object is set to ssm(2) or dm(5), then alaPimStaticRPRPAddress must be set to zero. No RP operations are ever possible for PIM Mode SSM or DM.

alaPimStaticRPOverrideDynamic.name: alaPimStaticRPOverrideDynamic
alaPimStaticRPOverrideDynamic.description: Whether this static RP configuration overrides RP information learned dynamically for groups in this group prefix.

alaPimStaticRPPrecedence.name: alaPimStaticRPPrecedence
alaPimStaticRPPrecedence.description: The value for alaPimGroupMappingPrecedence to be used for this static RP configuration. This allows fine control over which configuration is overridden by this static configuration. If alaPimStaticRPOverrideDynamic is set to TRUE, all dynamic RP configuration is overridden by this static configuration, whatever the value of this object. The absolute values of this object have a significance only on the local router and do not need to be coordinated with other routers. A setting of this object may have different effects when applied to other routers. Do not use this object unless fine control of static RP behavior on the local router is required. A value of 65535 is used to represent an 'undefined' value indicating that this object is not being used.

alaPimStaticRPRowStatus.name: alaPimStaticRPRowStatus
alaPimStaticRPRowStatus.description: The status of this row, by which rows in this table can be created and destroyed. This status object cannot be set to active(1) before valid values have been written to alaPimStaticRPRPAddress. All writeable objects in this entry can be modified when the status of this entry is active(1).

alaPimStaticRPStorageType.name: alaPimStaticRPStorageType
alaPimStaticRPStorageType.description: The storage type for this row. Rows having the value 'permanent' need not allow write-access to any columnar objects in the row.

alaPimGroupMappingTable.name: alaPimGroupMappingTable
alaPimGroupMappingTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing mappings from multicast group prefixes to the PIM mode and RP address to use for groups within that group prefix. Rows in this table are created for a variety of reasons, indicated by the value of the alaPimGroupMappingOrigin object. - Rows with a alaPimGroupMappingOrigin value of 'fixed' are created automatically by the router at startup, to correspond to the well-defined prefixes of link-local and unroutable group addresses. These rows are never destroyed. - Rows with a alaPimGroupMappingOrigin value of 'embedded' are created by the router to correspond to group prefixes that are to be treated as being in Embedded-RP format. - Rows with a alaPimGroupMappingOrigin value of 'configRp' are created and destroyed as a result of rows in the alaPimStaticRPTable being created and destroyed. - Rows with a alaPimGroupMappingOrigin value of 'configSsm' are created and destroyed as a result of configuration of SSM address ranges to the local router. - Rows with a alaPimGroupMappingOrigin value of 'bsr' are created as a result of running the PIM Bootstrap Router (BSR) mechanism. If the local router is not the elected BSR, these rows are created to correspond to group prefixes in the PIM Bootstrap messages received from the elected BSR. If the local router is the elected BSR, these rows are created to correspond to group prefixes in the PIM Bootstrap messages that the local router sends. In either case, these rows are destroyed when the group prefixes are timed out by the BSR mechanism. - Rows with a alaPimGroupMappingOrigin value of 'other' are created and destroyed according to some other mechanism not specified here. Given the collection of rows in this table at any point in time, the PIM mode and RP address to use for a particular group is determined using the following algorithm. 1. From the set of all rows, the subset whose group prefix contains the group in question are selected. 2. If there are no such rows, the behavior is undefined. 3. From the selected subset of rows, the subset that have the greatest value of alaPimGroupMappingGrpPrefixLength are selected. 4. If there are multiple selected rows, and a subset are defined by alaPimStaticRPTable (alaPimGroupMappingOrigin value of 'configRp') with alaPimStaticRPOverrideDynanic set to TRUE, then this subset is selected. 5. If there are still multiple selected rows, the subset that have the highest precedence (the lowest numerical value for alaPimGroupMappingPrecedence) are selected. 6. If there are still multiple selected rows, the row selected is implementation dependent; the implementation might or might not apply the PIM hash function to select the row. 7. The group mode to use is given by the value of alaPimGroupMappingPimMode from the single selected row; the RP to use is given by the value of alaPimGroupMappingRPAddress, unless alaPimGroupMappingOrigin is 'embedded', in which case the RP is extracted from the group address in question.

alaPimGroupMappingEntry.name: alaPimGroupMappingEntry
alaPimGroupMappingEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the alaPimGroupMappingTable.

alaPimGroupMappingOrigin.name: alaPimGroupMappingOrigin
alaPimGroupMappingOrigin.description: The mechanism by which this group mapping was learned.

alaPimGroupMappingAddressType.name: alaPimGroupMappingAddressType
alaPimGroupMappingAddressType.description: The address type of the IP multicast group prefix.

alaPimGroupMappingGrpAddress.name: alaPimGroupMappingGrpAddress
alaPimGroupMappingGrpAddress.description: The IP multicast group address which, when combined with alaPimGroupMappingGrpPrefixLength, gives the group prefix for this mapping. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimGroupMappingAddressType object. This address object is only significant up to alaPimGroupMappingGrpPrefixLength bits. The remainder of the address bits are zero. This is especially important for this index field, which is part of the index of this entry. Any non-zero bits would signify an entirely different entry.

alaPimGroupMappingGrpPrefixLength.name: alaPimGroupMappingGrpPrefixLength
alaPimGroupMappingGrpPrefixLength.description: The multicast group prefix length, which, when combined with alaPimGroupMappingGrpAddress, gives the group prefix for this mapping. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimGroupMappingAddressType object. If alaPimGroupMappingAddressType is 'ipv4' or 'ipv4z', this object must be in the range 4..32. If alaPimGroupMappingAddressType is 'ipv6' or 'ipv6z', this object must be in the range 8..128.

alaPimGroupMappingRPAddressType.name: alaPimGroupMappingRPAddressType
alaPimGroupMappingRPAddressType.description: The address type of the RP to be used for groups within this group prefix, or unknown(0) if no RP is to be used or if the RP address is unknown. This object must be unknown(0) if alaPimGroupMappingPimMode is ssm(2) or dm(5), or if alaPimGroupMappingOrigin is embedded(6).

alaPimGroupMappingRPAddress.name: alaPimGroupMappingRPAddress
alaPimGroupMappingRPAddress.description: The IP address of the RP to be used for groups within this group prefix. The InetAddressType is given by the alaPimGroupMappingRPAddressType object.

alaPimGroupMappingPimMode.name: alaPimGroupMappingPimMode
alaPimGroupMappingPimMode.description: The PIM mode to be used for groups in this group prefix.

alaPimGroupMappingPrecedence.name: alaPimGroupMappingPrecedence
alaPimGroupMappingPrecedence.description: The precedence of this row, used in the algorithm that determines which row applies to a given group address (described above). Numerically higher values for this object indicate lower precedences, with the value zero denoting the highest precedence. The absolute values of this object have a significance only on the local router and do not need to be coordinated with other routers.

alaPimNeighborLoss.name: alaPimNeighborLoss
alaPimNeighborLoss.description: A alaPimNeighborLoss notification signifies the loss of an adjacency with a neighbor. This notification should be generated when the neighbor timer expires, and the router has no other neighbors on the same interface with the same IP version and a lower IP address than itself. This notification is generated whenever the counter alaPimNeighborLossCount is incremented, subject to the rate limit specified by alaPimNeighborLossNotificationPeriod.

alaPimInvalidRegister.name: alaPimInvalidRegister
alaPimInvalidRegister.description: A alaPimInvalidRegister notification signifies that an invalid PIM Register message was received by this device. This notification is generated whenever the counter alaPimInvalidRegisterMsgsRcvd is incremented, subject to the rate limit specified by alaPimInvalidRegisterNotificationPeriod.

alaPimInvalidJoinPrune.name: alaPimInvalidJoinPrune
alaPimInvalidJoinPrune.description: A alaPimInvalidJoinPrune notification signifies that an invalid PIM Join/Prune message was received by this device. This notification is generated whenever the counter alaPimInvalidJoinPruneMsgsRcvd is incremented, subject to the rate limit specified by alaPimInvalidJoinPruneNotificationPeriod.

alaPimRPMappingChange.name: alaPimRPMappingChange
alaPimRPMappingChange.description: A alaPimRPMappingChange notification signifies a change to the active RP mapping on this device. This notification is generated whenever the counter alaPimRPMappingChangeCount is incremented, subject to the rate limit specified by alaPimRPMappingChangeNotificationPeriod.

alaPimInterfaceElection.name: alaPimInterfaceElection
alaPimInterfaceElection.description: A alaPimInterfaceElection notification signifies that a new DR or DR has been elected on a network. This notification is generated whenever the counter alaPimInterfaceElectionsWinCount is incremented, subject to the rate limit specified by alaPimInterfaceElectionNotificationPeriod.

alaPimMIBComplianceAsm.name: alaPimMIBComplianceAsm
alaPimMIBComplianceAsm.description: The compliance statement for the PIM-SM MIB.

alaPimMIBComplianceSsm.name: alaPimMIBComplianceSsm
alaPimMIBComplianceSsm.description: The compliance statement for PIM SSM MIB.

alaPimMIBComplianceDm.name: alaPimMIBComplianceDm
alaPimMIBComplianceDm.description: The compliance statement for PIM-DM MIB.

alaPimTopologyGroup.name: alaPimTopologyGroup
alaPimTopologyGroup.description: A collection of read-only objects used to report local PIM topology.

alaPimNotificationGroup.name: alaPimNotificationGroup
alaPimNotificationGroup.description: A collection of notifications for signaling important PIM events.

alaPimTuningParametersGroup.name: alaPimTuningParametersGroup
alaPimTuningParametersGroup.description: A collection of writeable objects used to configure PIM behavior and to tune performance.

alaPimRouterStatisticsGroup.name: alaPimRouterStatisticsGroup
alaPimRouterStatisticsGroup.description: A collection of statistics global to the PIM router.

alaPimSsmGroup.name: alaPimSsmGroup
alaPimSsmGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM routers running the PIM SSM (Source Specific Multicast) protocol, in PIM mode SM (Sparse Mode).

alaPimRPConfigGroup.name: alaPimRPConfigGroup
alaPimRPConfigGroup.description: A collection of objects to support configuration of RPs (Rendezvous Points) and Group Mappings.

alaPimSmGroup.name: alaPimSmGroup
alaPimSmGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM routers running PIM-SM (Sparse Mode). The groups alaPimSsmGroup and alaPimRPConfigGroup are also required.

alaPimStaticRPPrecedenceGroup.name: alaPimStaticRPPrecedenceGroup
alaPimStaticRPPrecedenceGroup.description: A collection of objects to allow fine control of interactions between static RP configuration and dynamically acquired group to RP mappings.

alaPimNetMgmtNotificationObjects.name: alaPimNetMgmtNotificationObjects
alaPimNetMgmtNotificationObjects.description: A collection of objects to support notification of PIM network management events.

alaPimNetMgmtNotificationGroup.name: alaPimNetMgmtNotificationGroup
alaPimNetMgmtNotificationGroup.description: A collection of notifications for signaling PIM network management events.

alaPimDiagnosticsGroup.name: alaPimDiagnosticsGroup
alaPimDiagnosticsGroup.description: Objects providing additonal diagnostics related to a PIM router.

alaPimDmGroup.name: alaPimDmGroup
alaPimDmGroup.description: A collection of objects required for management of PIM Dense Mode (PIM-DM) function. The groups alaPimSsmGroup and alaPimSmGroup are also required.

alaPimDeviceStorageGroup.name: alaPimDeviceStorageGroup
alaPimDeviceStorageGroup.description: An object that specifies the volatility of global PIM configuration settings on this device.
